intro: Leptochilus exsculptus, commonly known as the sculptured liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure that forms dense, cushion-like growths on moist, shaded surfaces. The plant typically grows in cool, humid environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are closely arranged and often have a distinctive, sculpted appearance, giving it its common name. Leptochilus exsculptus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for small invertebrates.
